result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P. Becker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven P. Becker in court with attorney Sasa G Johnen.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to Misd. Battery 940.19 and recommendations stated.  Atty Johnen agrees.  State moves to amend.  Court grants amendment.  Atty Johnen enters Guilty pleas on Cts 1 and 2.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Johnen makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  **as amended  -  Guilty
Probation for 2 years
Conditions of probation:
$543.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Court's Office TODAY or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment/Anger Management/Domestic Abuse counseling and any other counseling per agent

Ct 2:  Guilty
30 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 6/25/2016 at 6:00 pm
2 days sentence credit
EMP approved per jail rules
DNA sample to be provided
$543.00 costs/surcharges to be paid TODAY or set up payment plan w/Clerk of Court's Office
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Steven P. Becker in court with attorney Sasa G Johnen.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johnen states there are details to work out but believes it will be resolved.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Steven P. Becker by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Steven P. Becker in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE doesn't qualify for PD appt.  State requests signature bond.  Advised rights to an attorney.
